items.title: IPO | SEBI approves Hyundai Motor Indiaâ€™s $3-bn IPO & Swiggyâ€™s $1.25-bn IPO
items.description: Big IPOs set to hit the street as market regulator SEBI clears food delivery & quick commerce player Swiggy's confidential IPO filing. Auto major Hyundai's $3 bn issue could be India's biggest ever. Vinnii Motiwala with more details.

items.title: Shivalik Bimetal sees Rs 500 crore worth equities change hands in block deal
items.description: The block deal in Shivalik Bimetal Control was executed at a floor price of Rs 611 per share, reflecting a near one percent discount from the previous closing price.

items.title: Live: Will the record-breaking rally continue for 7th straight day? Nifty rejig in focus | Opening Bell
items.description: The unstoppable record run continues for benchmark indices! Sensex mounted on 85,900-mark for the first time and Nifty touched 26,250 on the monthly F&O expiry day. However, broader markets continued to languish, with midcaps trailing for the second straight day. Market observers are debating whether this uptrend can sustain in the near-term as well as focus will soon shift towards India Inc's second quarterly earnings. Accenture's increase revenue guidance for FY25 is likely to set a positive tone for technology stocks. Experts suggest that Nifty 50's new resistance level is set at 26,300, with immediate support at 26,000. This morning global cues are fairly strong. Wall Street clocked a strong close overnight, with S&P 500 ending on a record note and NASDAQ Composite extending gains to fourth day. Asia Pacific markets also rose this morning as China's stimulus measures take effect. Among stocks in focus, watch out for IT counters, Biocon, Nuvama Wealth, among others. Meanwhile, NSE index rejig is set to take place, with BEL and Trent set to enter Nifty 50, replacing Divi's Lab and LTIMindtree. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder NeoTrader & Trading Influencer and Shrikant S. Chouhan, EVP â€“Research, Private Client Group, Kotak Securities.

items.title: UBS initiates 'sell' calls on slew of pharma majors; sees growth slowdown in India & US mkts
items.description: UBS initiated 'sell' calls on Dr Reddy's Laboratories Lupin, Aurobindo Pharma and Zydus Lifesciences while picking Sun Pharma and Cipla as its preferred bets in the pharmaceutical sector.

items.title: Agri Picks Report September 27, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, Farmers in Telangana have sown kharif crops over 12.98 mln acres as of Wednesday, down 0.4% from 13 mln acres covered in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state's agricultural department.

items.description: BPCL shares surged 7 percent to a fresh all-time high of Rs 370.50 on NSE, fueled by heavy trading volumes and strong investor sentiment.

items.title: Wagers on stronger Indian rupee grow on dovish Fed outlook, yuan rally
items.description: For the first time in six months, the cost of betting on a rise in the Indian rupee has surpassed the cost of wagering on its decline, driven by anticipated U.S. rate cuts and a Chinese yuan rally. Investors are now paying a premium for rupee call options, reflecting growing optimism.
